comment: He is one of the greatest. He truly care about his students. you always can ask for help. he is available everyday after and before class (lots of office hours), lots of opportunities for extra credit. and the most important his lectures are amazing!!!

He truly cares about his students and is always available to help! The class is swords, but he has clearly done his best to get people through the class as well as possible, and there are plenty of opportunities to get extra cardits.
Dr. S was a fun professor. Class discussions were fun and he really cared about how we did in all classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: Gives clear instructions and follows the syllabus. He expects students to do the work, but will provide more guidance and help when needed. A solid professor at KSU!

He doesn't give clear explanations for homework or the big project you have to do. He doesn't give you any heads up for the assignments that are due. He also gets angry when you try to ask him about his syllabus. His lectures do not relate to class material but are fun to listen in on.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--Tests? Not many

comment: Really cares about how class is doing and being successful students. Does a good job of reminding class to turn in assignments.
Enjoyed the class and discussions.  Assignments were not too bad.  Few group projects and papers were due.

Interesting debates, decent guy, makes you participate in discussion. Beware of pop quizzes. He doesn't really remind you of things that are due, and there are a ton of assignments due online, so you HAVE to keep up with the syllabus. Group projects, long research paper APA style, and a lot of busy work. Easy A because there are so many grades.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: A great class and professor.  The topics can seem easy, but he does a good job making them connect.  He does take the topic seriously, but that is a good thing.

Really enjoyed his teaching style.  He truly cares about how we did in the class and preparing us for other classes.  There is a good bit of reading and work, but it was always focused on preparation.  I never felt like there was just busy work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Really focused on class discussion and participation. You will do well if you keep up with reading and discuss in class.

He was amazingly helpful and truly seemed to want us to succeed.  Students will complain over pop quizzes, but he only gave one all semester.  All other assignments were clear and given to us way in advance.
Does a good job of explaining what is required and due during the course.  Participation in discussions is expected, but he will lecture if students don't talk.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very easy grader. Clear grading system but watch out for assignments not showing due dates on D2L so make sure to read syllabus and watch the due dates for assignments. Great professor.

He's not that bad but he does care to much for an easy class. I wouldn't take him again but he does know about his material. You will have group projects and research papers. He goes strong on participation.
He makes you do so much for a simple class. You will hate KSU Seminar !! He takes it too seriously , makes you do group projects and research papers. Get another professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: horrible. DO NOT TAKE HIM. doesn't make you do much in class, but also will not remind you when anything is due. loves pop quizzes. waits till the end of the year to make everything due and does not give clear explanations or expectations.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: He's nice except when he wants to give out pop quizzes. He usually does when no one wants to participate but that happens more often than not. Assignments are on his syllabus and he doesn't remind you about them in class so make sure you look at it as often as you can. His lectures come directly out of the textbook and so do the assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: For a freshman seminar class he expects a lot. He takes this class very seriously. Expect to write a lot and make sure to keep up with the assignments. He does not give you a reminder or heads up so you have to remember on your own that something is due. He'll give pop quizzes if no one participates. My friends had a much easier professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES
